Image Class Reference

#include <Image.h>

Inheritance diagram for Image:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A image is a resource managed by the platform adapter that provides rendering of a bitmap read from a file resource.

Image bitmaps contain an alpha channel, which enables blending.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Type
 

The image type when creating an image.

See also:
PlatformAdapter::createImage()
Enumeration values:
TYPE_RGB  The image contains color (RGB) information, but no alpha channel.

When rendering to this image, alpha information in the source is used to blend the source with the existing image content. When rendering the image to another image or to the desktop, the content will be considered as opaque (only the alpha value supplied to the respective operation is used).

See also:
PlatformAdapter::createImage()
TYPE_RGB_ALPHA  The image contains color (RGB) information and an alpha channel.

When rendering to this image, alpha information in the source is set into this target image. Blending is not performed in this case, i.e. the color and alpha information is rendered opaquely. When rendering the image to another image or to the desktop, the alpha channel will be used for blending.

TYPE_ALPHA  The image contains an alpha channel only.

When rendering to this image, alpha information in the source is set into this target image. Blending is not performed in this, case i.e. the alpha information is rendered opaquely.

Destroys the image.

Image (  const String &  path,
Type  imageType
) 
 

Creates a new image.

Parameters:
path The path of the image file, may be relative or absolute. Relative paths are relative to the application's executable location. An empty string indicates a render target that isn't loaded from a file.
imageType The type of the image (whether the image contains RGB and/or alpha information).

Member Function Documentation

void appendListener (  Listener *  listener  )  [inherited]
 

Adds a listener at the end of the listeners of this listenable object.

Appended listeners are called last.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

virtual void ensureLoaded (   )  [virtual]
 

Ensures that the image is loaded, if it is file-based.

Does nothing if it is a render target.

See also:

const ArrayList<Listener>& getListeners (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns all currently registered listeners.

Listeners are called in the order they have been appended.

Returns:
The listeners.

Vector getMaximumSize (   ) 
 

Returns the maximum size of this image.

Resize and image load operations are constrained to this size. Defaults to (0,0), which does not constrain.

Returns:
The maximum size of this image.

void* getModel (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Returns:
The application (or game) defined data.

const String& getPath (   ) 
 

Returns the path of the image file, may be relative or absolute.

Relative paths are relative to the application's executable location. An empty string indicates a render target that isn't loaded from a file.

Returns:
The path of the image file or an empty string.

virtual Vector getSize (   )  [virtual]
 

Returns the current size of the image.

Returns:
The current size of the image.

SkinData* getSkinData (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Returns:
The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

virtual void resize (  Vector  size  )  [virtual]
 

Check that the given image's size is at least as large as a given size.

You can reserve some additional space to reduce reallocation, and you can reduce the space if the new size is smaller.

Parameters:
size The required size.

void setMaximumSize (  Vector  maximumSize  ) 
 

Sets the maximum size of this image.

Resize and image load operations are constrained to this size. Defaults to (0,0), which does not constrain.

Parameters:
maximumSize The maximum size of this image.

void setModel (  void *  model,
void(*  modelDestructor)(void *model) = NULL
)  [inherited]
 

Sets the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Parameters:
model The application (or game) defined data.
modelDestructor An optional static method that is called, whenever the glaziery object is destroyed or when a new model is set. Specify this function only, if the model must be destroyed by this glaziery object, i.e. the object "owns" the model. If the model is a glaziery object itself, you may use the GlazieryObject::destructor() function.
See also:
destructor()

virtual void setSkinData (  SkinData *  skinData  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Sets the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Parameters:
skinData The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

Any previously set skin data is automatically destroyed.

Reimplemented in Component.
